Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, making sure to show each as either a land habitat (like a garden or forest) or a water habitat (like a pond or stream).
The student can draw different living things in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, lizards, or squirrels.
The student can draw different living things in the water habitat, such as fish or clams.
The student can show comparisons by noting how the types of living things differ between the two habitats in their drawings.
The student can observe and include patterns in diversity by showing a variety of living things in each habitat.
